catalysts.description: First-ever FDA approval of a CAR-T therapy — for pediatric ALL
FDA approval for relapsed/refractory DLBCL
FDA approval for relapsed/refractory LBCL
First CAR-T for multiple myeloma (BCMA-targeting)
FDA approval expanded to 2L+ multiple myeloma (CARTITUDE-4)
Takeda divests from cell therapy, returning rights to partner
Novo Nordisk exits cell therapy development
Galapagos steps back from cell therapy pipeline
AZ acquires in vivo CAR-T company EsoBiotec for $1B ($425M upfront)
catalysts.outcome: First major in vivo CAR-T acquisition

catalysts.description: AbbVie acquires LNP-based in vivo CAR-T company for $2.1B
catalysts.outcome: Validates in vivo approach for autoimmune

catalysts.description: Gilead reports ~10-15% YoY sales decline for Yescarta and Tecartus vs Q3 2024
BMS acquires circular RNA in vivo cell therapy company for $1.5B
catalysts.outcome: Third major in vivo deal in 2025

catalysts.description: Gilead acquires in vivo CAR-T company (terms undisclosed)
catalysts.outcome: Even ex vivo leader pivoting to in vivo

catalysts.description: Preclinical data at ASH 2025 showing B-cell and plasma cell depletion with circular RNA in vivo CAR-T
Lilly acquires Orna for up to $2.4B — circular RNA + LNP in vivo CAR-T for autoimmune diseases. ORN-252 (CD19) described as 'clinical-trial ready'.
catalysts.outcome: Fifth major in vivo deal. ~$7B+ total in vivo M&A in 12 months.

catalysts.description: IND filing and Phase 1 initiation expected — in vivo CD19 CAR-T for autoimmune diseases
Clinical data expected from early-stage in vivo CAR-T programs
IND-enabling studies and potential clinical entry
Phase 1 data for lentiviral in vivo CAR-T in r/r NHL
Preclinical/IND-enabling data for in vivo cell therapy programs
First wave of Phase 1 clinical data from acquired in vivo programs (Lilly/Orna, AbbVie/Capstan, AZ/EsoBiotec)
